titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the G. Hoyt Whipple photographs.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.
descgrp.relatedmaterial: Material related to the Stanley Quartet, including photographs, also can be found in Gilbert Ross papers. Finding aid: http://www.hti.umich.edu/cgi/f/findaid/findaid-idx?c=bhlead&idno=umich-bhl-85378

archdesc.bioghist: G. Hoyt Whipple was the University of Michigan professor of environmental and industrial health, research scientist, and photographer. The University of Michigan School of Music Stanley Quartet was one of the earliest of the ensembles in residence established at shools of music in the U.S. The quartet performed between 1949 and 1970.
archdesc.scopecontent: Black-and-white photographs of members of the Stanley Quartet, taken by G. Hoyt Whipple in November 1962. Collection includes images of Gilbert Ross, Gustave Rosseels, Robert Courte, and Jerome Jelinek, holding their instruments.
